result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David C Stahl

defendant.name: Stahl, David C
defendant.address: 3900 W. Brown Deer Road Box 219, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt: to be done outpatient, signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr November 3, 2022.
Review hearing on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:06 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant David C Stahl not in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for David C Stahl.  Prosecuting attorney Patrick Ryan Campbell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Herbers advises he has been in contact with his client and is not able to appear today due to some mental health treatment.  Based on that information Atty. Herbers raises issues of competency. 
 DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days, but noting that the defendant is anticipated to be placed in a mental health treatment facility very soon.  Atty. Herbers advises he can reach out to the doctor to advise them where the defendant is located for the competency evaluation.  Court will adjourn for review hearing.  Court also notes there was a WCS non-compliance letter and will address that at the next court date as well.
Review hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

10:18 AM Defendant David C Stahl in court.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for David C Stahl.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Tracking 22CF1170.
Hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

02:56 PM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant David C Stahl in court with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Herbers requests this matter be set for status to tag along with 22CF1170 which is being set for preliminary hearing.  Court will tag this matter along with 22CF1170 for status.  Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key. Signed by Judge Laura F. Lau on 7/7/22

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Sheraton Hotel listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.

01:28 PM Defendant David C Stahl in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern Patrick Sicula.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
